question.title: is it possible to use json property to receive parameters from get parameters in java spring boot
question.body:
I am trying to receive parameters from get request, this is the client request look like:

http://example.com?xq_id=1

the server side, I defined a Model like this:

@Data
@Accessors(chain = true)
public class BaCyxxReq extends PageReq {
    
    private String keyword;
    
    @NotBlank(message = "xq_id can not be null")
    @JsonProperty("xq_id)
    private String xqId;
}

the server side always get the null for xqId field:

@GetMapping("/hqcyxx")
PageResult<List<QlrDTO>> getAreaMembers(@Valid @ModelAttribute BaCyxxReq req);

I have tried the @SpringQueryMap like this:

@GetMapping("/hqcyxx")
PageResult<List<QlrDTO>> getAreaMembers(@Valid @ModelAttribute BaCyxxReq req);

still could not work. Am I missing somethingï¼Ÿ is it possible to map the xq_id to xqId with model in spring boot application?

answers.body:
I just found a related SO question, and one of the simpler "hack" solutions is to add a setter.

    @GetMapping("/modeltest")
    public void testModel(@ModelAttribute Test test) {
        log.info("{}", test);
    }

    @Data
    public static class Test {
        private String keyword;
        private String xqId;

        public void setXq_id(String xqId) { //setxq_id also seems to work
            this.xqId = xqId;
        }
    }

upon calling curl -X GET 'http://localhost:8080/modeltest?xq_id=1' --header 'Content-Type: application/json', it logged Test(keyword=null, xqId=1) . Though this may not work for every case (i.e. if the request param is kebab case xq-id).

How to customize parameter names when binding Spring MVC command objects?

question_comments.body: I did find this one library that tries to address the shortcoming of the @ModelAttribute though github.com/mattbertolini/spring-annotated-web-data-binder
there contains many params the @RequestParam will make the parameters list too long

I believe this should be because of the request parameters you provide. For some reason, the JsonProperty does not seem to be effective and ModelAttribute will only look for xqId. Likely because ModelAttribute uses WebDataBinder and not Jackson?
I believe you can retrieve the query string values of the request using the @RequestParam annotation docs.spring.io/spring-framework/reference/web/webmvc/…
